results.title: Burden of dreams
results.brief_description: A documentary by Les Blank which provides a detailed look at the making of the ill-starred five year production of Werner Herzog’s feature film ‘Fitzcarraldo’. Set in the jungle of Peru ‘Fitzcarraldo’ is the story of an opera mad genius (played by Klaus Kinski) who will stop at nothing to achieve his ideal of building an opera house in the middle of the jungle. In many ways the narrative of Fitzcarraldo parallels Herzog’s production experiences. Despite one setback after another in filming: from monsoonal floods to warring native tribespeople, Herzog persisted with his dream until the film was complete. Not a conventional ‘behind-the-scenes’ promotional documentary, but a film which raises the question about the pursuit of art and what it can entail.

results.title: The Siege of Pinchgut
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: Made in Australia by Ealing Studios, this film is concerned with the escape from prison of a man who claims he has been unjustly incarcerated. He escapes and lands on Pinchgut Island in Sydney Harbour, occupies a disused arsenal and defies a police seige by taking the caretaker and his family hostage. Stars Aldo Ray and Heather Sears with Richard Vernon, Grant Taylor and Kenneth Warren. Screenplay by Harry Watt and Jon Cleary.

results.title: Looks and smiles
results.creator_credit: Ken Loach, Irving Teitelbaum, Kestrel Films (Australia) and Black Lion Films
results.brief_description: This film by Ken Loach, the Director of “Cathy come home”, “Family life and “Kes”, takes a bleak but compassionate look at working-class life in contemporary Britain. It is set in Industrialized Sheffield and while not an attack on the system, the film implicity condemns the system’s failure to cope with economic fluctuations. Script by Barry Hines.

results.title: The Battleship Potemkin
results.brief_description: This full length version of one of the most important films in the history of silent cinema portrays the mutiny aboard the Russian battleship Potemkin and the role of the sailors and citizens of the Port of Odessa in the abortive revolution of 1905. It brought to the attention of the world the theories of Sergei Eisenstein, his emphasis on montage, stress on intellectual content and his treatment of the mass instead of the individual as protagonist. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students.

results.title: Finding Nemo
results.creator_credit: Andrew Stanton, Graham Walters, Walt Disney Pictures and Pixar Animation Studios
results.brief_description: When Nemo, a young clownfish, is unexpectedly carried far from home, his father Marlin, and Dory, a friendly but forgetful regal blue tang fish embark on an epic journey. Features the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem DaFoe, Brad Garrett.

results.title: Chicago
results.creator_credit: Rob Marshall, Martin Richards and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: A dazzling spectacle that glides between the intrigue of rivalry and betrayal to sensational fantasies of music and dance! At a time when crimes of passion result in celebrity headlines, nightclub sensation Velma Kelley and spotlight-seeking Roxie Hart find themselves sharing space on Chicago’s famed Murderess Row. Velma and Roxie will stop at nothing to outdo each other in their obsessive pursuit of fame and celebrity. Stars Rene Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere with Queen Latifah, John C. Reilly, Lucy Liu. Dion Beebe is director of photography. Based on the musical play Chicago, directed and choreographed for the stage by Bob Fosse; based on the play by Maurine Dallas Watkins. (Awards: Winner of several awards including Winner of 2003 Academy Awards for Best Motion Picture of the Year; Winner of 2003 BAFTA Film Awards for Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role: Catherine Zeta-Jones; Winner of 2003 Golden Globes Awards for Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy)

results.title: The Princess diaries
results.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Mario Iscovich and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Mia Thermopolis is a bright but terribly shy and gawky teenager whose goal in life is to survive each school day with a minimum of attention and embarrassment. Unfortunately, her wish to be invisible is thwarted when her strict grandmother arrives and delivers the shocking news that she’s a real-life princess - heir to the throne of Genovia. Based on the novel by Meg Cabot. Cast includes Anne Hathaway, Heather Matarazzo, Hector Elizondo, Julie Andrews, Mandy Moore, Caroline Goodall.

results.title: Monkey trouble
results.creator_credit: Franco Amurri, Mimi Polk and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Dodger, a monkey, belongs to a crooked street performer but escapes, his life to end up in the arms of an innocent little girl. Her mother has no idea that her daughter is harboring a fugitive. Unfortunately, Dodger’s naughty habits get the best of him as his mischief plunges everyone he meets into major monkey trouble. Cast includes Thora Birch, Mimi Rogers, Victor Argo, Christopher McDonald, Harvey Keitel.

results.title: Tarzan and his mate
results.creator_credit: Jack Conway, Cedric Gibbons, Bernard H. Hyman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The second Tarzan film starring Johnny Weissmuller who succeeded Elmo Lincoln (the ‘silent’ Tarzan) as the King of the Apes finds him settled with the Englishwoman Jane in their jungle domain until disturbed by two white hunters from Mayfair (one a former beau of Jane’s) in search of ivory. The thirties MGM series, of which Tarzan and His Mate is widely considered to be the best, had above average production values (set designer Cedric Gibbons is credited here as co-director) with well staged action in the studio jungle. Pre-dating the stiffening of the industry censorship code in the thirties, Tarzan and His Mate is considerably less coy about sexuality than the later entrants in the series. Cast also includes Maureen O’Sullivan, Neil Hamilton, Paul Cavanagh, Forrester Harvey, Nathan Curry.

results.title: I'll cry tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Daniel Mann, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Biographical film about American singer actress Lillian Roth, her rise to fame in Hollywood and on Broadway and her eventual downhill path into self-destruction and alcoholism brought on by a series of ill-fated relationships and a domineering ambitious mother. Susan Hayward is superbe in her portrayal of Roth and equally Jo Van Fleet in the role of Roth’s mother. Cast also includes Richard Conte, Eddie Albert and Don Taylor. Based on the book of the same title by Lillian Roth, Mike Connolly and Gerold Frank. (Award: Oscar for Best Costume Design (Helen Rose))
